awd_titl_txt: Industry Internship:  Experimental Investigation of Flow    Behavior in Mechanical Seal Chambers Using Laser Doppler    Velocimetry Technique
awd_abstract_narration: The objective of the research is to understand the effects of              the throat wall and angle of taper on the overall                               mixing of flow in the seal chamber of enlarged cylindrical and                  tapered mechanical seals.  This research will lead to fundamental               understanding of flow behavior in the seal chambers.  As a result               of this understanding, new seal chamber design for improved                     overall cooling of the seal faces is expected.  In addition, by                 tracing plastic particles seeded in the flow, the seal chamber                  shape will be optimized to reduce the erosive effects of abrasive               particles and reduce leakage for pollution control.  Thus, this                 research will contribute to advancement of pump and mechanical                  seal manufacturing technology by providing appropriate means to                 increase the mean time between failures for these products.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation
